definition[0]: if a child grows out of clothes, he or she becomes too big to wear them
definition[1]: if someone grows out of something, they stop doing it as they get older
example[0]: Mike finally seems to be growing out of his rebelliousness.
definition[2]: to develop or happen as a result of something else that happened or existed
example[1]: His art grew out of his love of nature.
example[2]: legislation which grew out of concern over the increasing crime rate
